storyInfo: Vina finally decides to represent Parliament by publicly declaring a series of future programs, including one aimed at resettling the Exemplars. Though the sudden and secretive arrival of the dukes in the city alongside the theft of the crown leads to new troubles.

attributes.content: <p=1>Knights of the Tower Watchtower Backyard</><p=2>December 22nd, 1098, 5:32 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: I thought you'd have gotten everyone to help fix up the guts of this tower by now.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: And I thought you'd be getting ready for the Speaker's speech, Vina. I'd rather not meddle with the designers while they work anyway.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: They know how to build a museum better than I do, and I'm looking forward to what little surprises the 'Knights of the Tower Museum' they're making has in store for me.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: But carving a monument commemorating the Knights? That's something I've got to do myself.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Here, have a look. How is it?
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Never took you for a sculptor.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Master Mitchell taught me how when I was really young. Though he'd always get so drunk he'd forget to teach me his special techniques.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Come on over and I'll introduce you. This is Master Finn, the last Captain of the Watch, and the elder knight I was closest to.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: This is Old Ferguson, the one who taught me to drink. This is Master Bailey, who did her best to teach me how to do makeup.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: And here's Master Mitchell—not my carving, though. He made it himself after a night at the pub.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: This is Carl, the crybaby. This is Martin. Every week he'd sneak off before getting sent back by his family. This is Karen...
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: And then there's... There's...
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Vina gently hugs Dagda, comforting her.
Thanks, Vina, but I'm fine.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: It's just that every time I come back here, those fading memories of mine become a lot clearer.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: You carved your own name too. 'Isabelle Montague'...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: The Knights of the Tower never left. We're still here. Master Finn would be glad to hear it.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: You know, Parliament could retain the institution of the Knights, even if you—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Our duty is already over, no?
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Victoria has no need for a monarch, so naturally she has no need for the Knights. Let the past be remembered in a museum. That's the best ending we could ask for.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Since there's no more need to light up the tower for the palace's sake, my own duty's done as well.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: These days, Londinium is no longer home to Isabelle, the Knight of the Tower. There's just Dagda now. Dagda of the Glasgow Gang.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: But Vina, if you still have need of the Knights, I won't hesitate. Just say the word.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Oh, don't tease me, Dagda. You heard those rumors too?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: We've been looking into who's been spreading them. But it seems there's a lot of people who believe, even wholeheartedly support the idea that—
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: 'Vina Victoria will be crowned King.'
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: <p=1>Saint-Marsol's College</><p=2>December 22nd, 1098, 5:37 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: Eliseo! Eliseo! Please wait!
attributes.name: Sulking Child

attributes.content: Oh, Jenna. More questions you'd like to ask me?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Miss Molly wants to invite you to stay and watch us rehearse our new play—
attributes.name: Sulking Child

attributes.content: Also, Eliseo, could you help me prove something?
attributes.name: Sulking Child

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Jamie and I had a wager. That even if my gran and I moved to Columbia, we wouldn't be much better off than we are now.
attributes.name: Sulking Child

attributes.content: His dad said that in Columbia, kids like us wouldn't get to go to school, and there wouldn't be any teachers who'd want to teach us how to do plays...
attributes.name: Sulking Child

attributes.content: Jamie said everything you told us in class was a lie.
attributes.name: Sulking Child

attributes.content: Jenna, you should be up on stage for the rehearsal. Don't be bothering Eliseo now.
Ah! M—Miss Molly!
attributes.name: Sulking Child

attributes.content: I was just inviting him to stay and watch...
attributes.name: Sulking Child

attributes.content: Allow me. Jamie's waiting for you on stage. He's about to cry any moment now.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Without you, he can't say any of his lines. Go on.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Oh, he's so annoying... Alright, I'll go...
attributes.name: Sulking Child

attributes.content: You've got to stay and watch, Eliseo!
attributes.name: Sulking Child

attributes.content: *sigh* Do forgive the children, Eliseo. They tend to just speak their mind.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: I must admit, I'm not too familiar with Columbia, and I'm not entirely sure how Infected children would be treated—
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: They'd be treated very well!
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: ...So long as their guardians can afford health insurance.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: I see.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: The children are very fond of you, and I'm grateful that you took the time to explain how they should take care of themselves after infection. It's important for them to know.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Thank you, truly.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: I have to give the same lectures to kids back home pretty often, so it's no trouble at all. Honestly, I'd like to thank you for letting me teach them.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: I thought since Parliament's on bad terms with Pure Heart Medical, the schools wouldn't let me near the children.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Parliament's never forbidden us from reaching out to you though? On the contrary, they tend to approve of this sort of thing as long as we're quiet about it, up to a certain degree.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Not just you, either. We've also invited Rhodes Island's doctors over to give the children checkups and lessons.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Parliament knows that children will need assistance.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: But there's only so much that checkups and lessons can do for them. What they need is medicine and treatment.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: I know. But all we can do now is stay by their side and make sure they are not overcome by fear.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: At least at this school, they can still live like how they used to... Like regular people.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: I really admire you, Molly.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Back home, if a young Infected is as energetic as these kids here, it usually means their family is pretty well-off.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: But here... I hear some kids had nowhere to go, so you gave them shelter at the school. You've got them putting on plays, ones that bring hope to the people here.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: That's amazing.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: You flatter me, Eliseo.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: I am merely following in the footsteps of those teachers who can no longer return to school... Especially the lady I respect the most.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Do you mean Lady Golding? I heard Heidi mention her before.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Yes. The play we are rehearsing today was the last she ever wrote in this classroom.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: It's a lovely little tale. Two young children go on many adventures to find a fowlbeast that can chase away any illness, which saves their sickly friend.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Lady Heidi once asked me if Lady Golding ever called it a 'meaningless consolation' when she was writing it...
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: But why?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Is it alright if I stay and watch them rehearse, Molly?
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: For the sake of the children, and so I can show how much I respect you, and your lady.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: I have a feeling that maybe here, in Londinium, there's still a lot I can do to help.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: ...For Lady Golding.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: ...For Lady Golding.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: Are all the MPs present?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: They are.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: How much longer until the city-wide broadcast?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Two minutes.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.text: It was an evening close to New Year's.

\nAfter several long years living in fear, most folk could finally feel at ease and enjoy dinner with their families, listening to the Speaker of Parliament's broadcast together. They even started calling it the 'Dinnertime Declaration' in jest.
\nPity that dinner didn't taste so good.

attributes.content: Testing, testing, *cough*—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Shall I begin?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Go ahead.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: This is Vina Victoria. As Speaker of Londinium's Parliament, I now address all the city's residents who took part in resistance during the war, and who yet live.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Two months ago, we walked out from the midst of tragedy.
attributes.name: Vina's Voice

attributes.content: You lot shut up! Can't you tell the Speaker's started her speech already?
attributes.name: Stressed Soldier

attributes.content: On behalf of Parliament, allow me to convey our respect to those heroes who contributed to the war effort.
attributes.name: Vina's Voice

attributes.content: Every citizen, every soldier of the ducal alliance, every fighter of the Exemplars.
attributes.name: Vina's Voice

attributes.content: The city will remember each and every one of your deeds, and honor all those who are no longer with us.
attributes.name: Vina's Voice

attributes.content: The pub falls silent as everyone lifts their cups.
To you, my brothers... and to me.
attributes.name: Stressed Soldier

attributes.content: Now, Londinium has begun her long road to recovery. Order will be reestablished, and those lives once so familiar to us will return.
attributes.name: Vina's Voice

attributes.content: But that's not all. In regards to the Exemplars, those glorious fighters of extraordinary circumstance, Parliament has decided to reserve this unit designation forevermore, so that we may commemorate both the past and the present of these troops.
attributes.name: Vina's Voice

attributes.content: I can hear the children singing, and the retired soldiers singing alongside them. Seems like they're in a good mood.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: The song they're singing is from the end of the play.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: The sickly child finally recovers, and together, they find happiness.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: I... expected those homeless soldiers to care a lot more about the Speaker's speech.
attributes.name: Eliseo

attributes.content: Of course they care, but they are of firm belief that the Speaker will not abandon them.
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: After all the suffering endured, happiness will surely come, Eliseo. Do you believe so?
attributes.name: Molly

attributes.content: The Exemplars came together once more for one simple dream: to go home. No matter their status, no matter their standing.
attributes.name: Vina's Voice

attributes.content: Now, this dream of theirs has become reality. We are home now. We have reached the end of the road.
attributes.name: Vina's Voice

attributes.content: Hah, 'reached the end of the road'.
attributes.name: Disdainful Mercenary

attributes.content: Seems this Speaker lady really is set on disbanding them. What an idiot, pulling apart your army of mates—
attributes.name: Disdainful Mercenary

attributes.content: Then what do you propose she should do with such a motley crew?
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Keep chasing those Sarkaz for the kill? Or set their sights on the dukes?
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Uh...
attributes.name: Disdainful Mercenary

attributes.content: We've got better things to worry about than the Exemplars.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Such as replenishing our strength as quickly as we can. Focus on that instead.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Many former Exemplars have joined the Defense Force's ranks, continuing to protect our homeland.
attributes.name: Vina's Voice

attributes.content: As for those who no longer wish to bear arms, they have the right to enjoy peace alongside their families.
attributes.name: Vina's Voice

attributes.content: Parliament promises each and every one of our Exemplar comrades a place to settle down. It may take a long time for this to come to fruition, but the door to the Speaker's office is forever open to my friends—
attributes.name: Vina's Voice

attributes.content: I'm afraid it'll take a few years to see this through. You've got a long road ahead of you, Vina.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Coming along for dinner, Catherine? There's a fair few old retired blokes who've reported back to the factory.
attributes.name: Happy Worker

attributes.content: They'll be real happy to see you!
attributes.name: Happy Worker

attributes.content: Sure you're not just angling for my stash of smokes? I worked real hard to collect them.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Hehe.
attributes.name: Happy Worker

attributes.content: Fine, fine, I'll come along. Oh, right. While you're at it, tell everyone to bring a few friends along.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Once Parliament helps us restart more factories, the hands we have now won't be enough.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: And I, Vina Victoria, do promise to every one of this city's residents, that in this coming future without a king—
attributes.name: Vina's Voice

attributes.content: The broadcast abruptly comes to an end. As it does so, Dagda hears an uproar suddenly echo through the skies above the city.
Why the cut-off? What's... What's going on at Parliament?
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Madam Speaker, Madam Delphine, while I was fixing up the broadcast system, I noticed this old component.
attributes.name: Nervous Worker

attributes.content: It's ancient scrap, should've been replaced when His Majesty Alistair was on the throne.
attributes.name: Nervous Worker

attributes.content: Who would've thought an unremarkable thing like this could still hold up until now! My mentor never told me anything about this!
attributes.name: Nervous Worker

attributes.content: So it's all just an accident?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Why was there suddenly something on your maintenance checklist that wasn't there before?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Iؙ—I just followed what the system synced up to me—
attributes.name: Nervous Worker

attributes.content: Ladies and gentlemen, may I sit in on this round of parliamentary discussion?
Earl of March.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Eleanor. My name's not hard to remember, Vina.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: You seem rather surprised to see me here. What, did no one tell you?
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: It seems your informants have been lax of late, Lady Delphine.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Londinium has no need for... 'informants' to host a guest, my Lady. The city welcomes every Victorian who loves this land.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Lovely to hear.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Then I suppose you won't mind if I invite a few dukes to revisit an old haunt for a little reunion.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Judging by the time, they should be arriving any moment now. Considering their sensitive position, the dukes are hesitant to drop in on any specific person's home, so I was forced to borrow one of your places.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: I hope Parliament will understand. You're also welcome to join in, Vina. And you too of course, Delphine.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: I know you are about to leave for Windermere. There are a few old friends who hope you could take their condolences for your mother along with you.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Eleanor doffs her hat, greeting Delphine with a smile.
She then immediately walks to Vina's side and lowers her voice.
I loved your speech, a very sensible decision. Yet...
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Far, far too impatient. There are some things you are free to say to us, but not to the common public.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: This is for their own good, and yours too.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: So you were the one who cut our signal.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: We'll be assembling at the Royal Academy of Sciences, Vina. It won't take too long, so don't be late.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: By the by, sometimes, there's no need for you to think you haven't done enough. The changes this city has seen are far beyond what I imagined.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: <p=1>Royal Victorian Academy of Sciences Reception Room</><p=2>December 22nd, 1098, 7:32 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: I assumed Your Grace would have less of an appetite.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: I've always been a practical lad, Eleanor.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: We all know the situation in Londinium. This light wine and bread is already enough to show us the Speaker's good faith.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: The Duke of Wellington is absent, yet again.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: *sigh* It seems the alliance between yourself and His Grace is not as reliable as we imagined.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: We all know we're here for more than just pleasantries, Your Grace. Old Wellington would never have come in the first place.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: How do you believe we should treat with Duke of Wellington, Vina?
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: If it has naught to do with Londinium, it has naught to do with me.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Oh, really?
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Would he really care what you all think? He's always been one to seize the initiative.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: All I know is that since the battle for the walls ended two months ago, the engines of the Gastrell and the other frigates have not rested for even a moment.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Wellington has been waiting for you to bite, and I'm afraid to say that he's very disappointed in you all.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Quite right.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: But what you see is merely one side of the matter, Delphine Windermere.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: In Old Wellington's eyes, it is still far far too early to decide what sort of relationship will exist between Tara and Victoria.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: In these two months, we have had a... tacit understanding. So long as nobody moves to break the silence, then silence we shall enjoy.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: But really, it's Her Grace over here whose emissaries are always sneaking into Wellington's demesne. She's much better qualified than I to speak on the matter, no?
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: Once I return, I will be investigating who has been going against my orders.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: After you return to Windermere, young Delphine, I would happily welcome some tired guests at the Lynncardine winery, whenever you like—
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: Could we dispense with the banalities already?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Londinium may welcome all Victorians, but we have no time to waste chatting with each and every one of them. There are still many issues affecting our citizens that need urgent handling, all more important than the people sitting here.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I am, of course, well aware that your sudden visit to Londinium is also thanks to an... ahem, tacit understanding.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I know that Wellington's only an excuse. Parliament will not interfere in this matter. So if what you're going to discuss next doesn't involve Parliament, then I don't need to waste my time here—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: That's where you're wrong, Vina. The Duke of Wellington's choice really does have something to do with you. Or to be more precise, it's to do with the late king. Your late father.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Twenty-six years ago, Old Wellington never cast a vote in the matter of how to handle your father. He simply watched in silence as King Alistair was led from the throne to the gallows...
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Thereafter, he was disappointed. Disappointed in Victoria. Disappointed in the dukes. Disappointed in your father.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: From that moment on, the tug of Tara's undercurrent has never ceased.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Duke Windermere never mentioned any of this to me—
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Your mother didn't care. No one regretted executing the King. Sorry, Vina, you know I don't mean anything untoward.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Just because Old Wellington himself will never come to Londinium doesn't mean that he has no interest in the city, or in you.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: For the time being, we still do not know his true intentions. But just because the throne has sat idle for many years does not mean Victoria needs no king.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Vina does not understand where Eleanor is going with this. She already made clear her refusal long ago.
The kingship, the crown. They were never what she needed—
Bloody hell, Vina, patrol's just come by your office to tell you—
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: The crown's been stolen from the throne room!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Pardon?
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: It seems our meeting must be postponed, Speaker Victoria. There are side matters that require your attention.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: If you need help, Vina, you know where to find me.
attributes.name: The Young Duke

attributes.content: Chances are we'll be troubling you a little longer, Madam Speaker.
attributes.name: Duke of Gododdin

attributes.content: You sodding—
attributes.name: Vina
